messages.content: Tell me about yourself.
I am a passionate AI enthusiast with a background in computer science. I've worked on several machine learning projects, and I'm eager to apply my skills in a professional setting.
Why do you want to work in the field of AI?
AI is transforming the world, and I want to be part of that change. I enjoy solving complex problems and building intelligent systems that have real-world impact.
Explain overfitting in simple terms.
Overfitting happens when a model learns the training data too well, including the noise, and performs poorly on new data.
What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
Supervised learning uses labeled data to train a model, while unsupervised learning finds patterns in data without labels.
How do you keep yourself updated in the AI field?
I regularly follow research papers, attend online courses, and experiment with open-source projects to stay updated.
What are your strengths?
I’m a fast learner, analytical thinker, and a strong communicator. I also work well in team environments.
What’s your biggest weakness?
Sometimes I dive too deep into technical details, but I’m learning to manage my time better and prioritize effectively.
Can you explain regularization?
Regularization is a technique used to prevent overfitting by adding a penalty term to the loss function.
What is your favorite AI project so far?
I built a chatbot that helped students practice interview questions using NLP and transformers. It was both fun and educational.
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
I see myself working as an AI engineer solving impactful problems, mentoring others, and contributing to open-source projects.
